result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Steinhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $4000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Complete mental health evaluation and follow through w/ recommendations.  Attend Victim Impact Panel.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 4 1/2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.  15CF204 is consecutive to any other sentence.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge.  Court imposes a fine of $4000 plus costs and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Atty Hilary Edwards specially for Atty Rufo. Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  State will be filing an amended Information regarding repeater language which will be 939.62(1)(b) and 4 years instead of 6 years.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
